intro: Erysimum hieraciifolium subsp. exaltatum, commonly known as the alpine wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
